conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow paths through baffles to determine final container
First image shows starting points (A, B, C, D) and destination containers (E, F)
Second and third images show actual liquid flow paths
Liquid A starts from leftmost position (orange tab)
Orange liquid drops straight down in images 2 and 3
Orange liquid follows left side of the board
Orange liquid reaches left container (E)
Liquid B starts from second position from the left (light blue/white tab)
Light blue/white liquid flows down and encounters several colored rods
Flow path of liquid B connects with mint/turquoise colored rod
Liquid B leads to mint/turquoise container on the right (F)
Liquid C starts from middle position (blue tab)
Blue liquid flows down and interacts with green rod
Flow of liquid C continues downward and to the left
Liquid C joins with paths from liquid B, leading to container F
Liquid D starts from right side (yellow tab)
Yellow liquid flows downward along right side of the board
Yellow liquid interacts with white rod
Path of liquid D continues downward to the right
Liquid D ends up in right container (F)
Container E receives liquid from point A only, container F receives liquids from points B, C, and D
